question: 躍進
sourceMnemonic:
When you <kanji>leap</kanji> and <kanji>advance</kanji>, you make <vocabulary>rapid progress</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>great advancement</vocabulary>.

You might recall that <ja>飛躍</ja> also means "rapid progress," but what sets them apart? <ja>躍進</ja> emphasizes the subject's perspective as it advances at a rapid pace, whereas <ja>飛躍</ja> conveys significant progress or leaps more neutrally, without highlighting pace or perspective.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
